Looking at the table, there are 9 entries under the "name" column, each representing a judge. So, the total number of judges is 9. Two-thirds of 9 is 6 (since 2/3 * 9 = 6). Therefore, to verify the claim, I need at least 6 judges with more than 10 years until retirement.

- Luis Estrella (Row 5): 27 > 10 → Yes
- Mildred (Row 6): 13 > 10 → Yes
- Rafael (Row 7): 15 > 10 → Yes
- Roberto (Row 8): 19 > 10 → Yes

That's a total of 6 judges with more than 10 years left. Since there are 9 judges in total, 6 is exactly two-thirds of 9. Therefore, the claim holds true.

I should also note which cells I checked for this determination. For each row, I looked at the "years until mandatory retirement" column to see if it was more than 10 years.
